diff_hunk:
@@ -5209,6 +5209,11 @@ def parse_kwargs(desc):
     For CPU tensors, this method is currently only available with MKL. Check
     :func:`torch.backends.mkl.is_available` to check if MKL is installed.
 
+.. note::
+    For CUDA tensors, setting ``torch.backends.cuda.cufft_cache_plan = True``
body: Actually, I was mistaken. We do always *check* the cache (even when benchmarking is turned off), but it looks like we don't store results in the cache unless benchmarking is on.
body_html: Actually, I was mistaken. We do always check the cache (even when benchmarking is turned off), but it looks like we don't store results in the cache unless benchmarking is on.
body_text: Actually, I was mistaken. We do always check the cache (even when benchmarking is turned off), but it looks like we don't store results in the cache unless benchmarking is on.
